alert.note: Alert for Eastern Uinta Basin; Eastern Uinta Mountains; Tavaputs Plateau (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 23 at 4:43PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...A strong areas of thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Moffat, northwestern Rio Blanco and east central Uintah Counties through 515 PM MDT... At 442 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Rangely, or 44 miles southeast of Vernal, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southwestern Moffat, northwestern Rio Blanco and east central Uintah Counties, including the following locations... Elk Springs, Blue Mountain, Massadona and Artesia. This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 40 in Colorado between mile markers 1 and 45. U.S. Highway 40 in Utah between mile markers 162 and 174. Colorado 64 between mile markers 1 and 48. Colorado 139 between mile markers 50 and 72. Colorado 318 between mile markers 45 and 46. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Uinta Basin; Eastern Uinta Mountains; Tavaputs Plateau
